subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: The semantics may have developed along the grammaticalisation process "bamboo stalk" ({{zh-l|*箇}}) > "piece, item" > "classifier for every category of noun" > "possessive particle, generic particle". If so, it would then possibly be cognate with {{och-l|竿|bamboo, rod}}. Compare {{cog|bo|མཁར་བ}}, {{m|bo|འཁར་བ||walking stick, staff}} and {{cog|th|ก้าน||stem, stalk}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=gè,ge,gě
|m_note=ge - classifier; gě - colloquial, used in {{zh-l|*自個兒}}
|m-s=go4
|c=go3
|c-t=goi1
|g=go4
|h=pfs=ke/kai;gd=gê4
|j=ge3
|md=gó̤/gá
|md_note=gó̤ - literary; gá - classifier
|mn=kò/ê/qz:gê/pn:lê
|mn_note=kò - literary (including classifier for months); ê/gê - generic classifier; ê - possessive particle (usually written as {{zh-l|*的}})
|mn-t=go6/gai5/gai7
|mn-t_note=go6 - literary; gai5 - classifier, or particle introducing the object of the verb (equivalent to {{zh-l|*把}}); gai7 - possessive particle;
|w=5geq,5hheq,4eq,2ku
|w_note=5geq ~ 5hheq ~ 4eq - classifier or particle; 2ku - literary
|x=go4
|ma=y
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,cl,part,a,adv
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text:
* For Min Nan, Taiwan's Ministry of Education recommends {{zh-l|*个}} for the general classifier ''ê'' and {{zh-l|*的}} for the possessive particle to differentiate them from {{zh-l|*個|kò}}.
* For Hakka, Taiwan's Ministry of Education recommends {{zh-l|个}} for the possessive particle.
